description: From New Latin ōs carpāle, from Ancient Greek καρπός (karpós, “wrist”).

entries.meaning: (anatomy) One of the bones or cartilages of the carpus, especially one of the series articulating with the metacarpals.
examples: […]  this being the case the bone in question contains at any rate the centrale, and I see no reason why the carpale 2 should have quite disappeared.
